pkgmetadata.longdescription: Utilities for Certara's Nonlinear Mixed-Effects Modeling Engine // Perform Nonlinear Mixed-Effects (NLME) Modeling using Certara's NLME-Engine. Access the same Maximum Likelihood engines used in the Phoenix platform, including algorithms for parametric methods, individual, and pooled data analysis. The Quasi-Random Parametric Expectation-Maximization Method (QRPEM) is also supported https://www.page- meeting.org/default.asp?abstract=2338. Execution is supported both locally or on remote machines. Remote execution includes support for Linux Sun Grid Engine (SGE), Simple Linux Utility for Resource Management (SLURM) grids, Linux and Windows multicore, and individual runs.
